title: ICBC participates in EUR 600 million syndicated loan with NLMK for general corporate purposes
description: In July 2020, OJSC Novolipetsk Steel (OJSC NLMK) signed a 4-year, EUR 600 million syndicated revolving credit facility with a group of Chinese and non-Chinese banks for general corporate purposes. The loan includes an accordion option that allows the borrower to increase the size of the loan to EUR 1 billion. ING Bank N.V. acted as Co-ordinating Mandated Lead Arranger. Crédit Agricole Corporate and Investment Bank, Natixis, Société Générale, AO Raiffeisenbank, Bank of America Merrill Lynch International Designated Activity Company, Mizuho Bank, Ltd., Deutsche Bank AG, London Branch, Bank ICBC (JSC), UniCredit S.p.A. and Intesa Sanpaolo Bank Ireland Plc acted as Mandated Lead Arrangers and UniCredit S.p.A. acted as Facility Agent.
staff_comments: 1. OJSC NLMK is a global steel producer headquartered in Lipetsk, Russia. 2. The size of ICBC’s contribution to the loan syndicate is unknown. For the time being, AidData assumes equal contributions (EUR 50 million) across the 12 known participants in the loan syndicate.
combined_text:
# Sector
BUSINESS AND OTHER SERVICES

# Title
ICBC participates in EUR 600 million syndicated loan with NLMK for general corporate purposes

# Description
In July 2020, OJSC Novolipetsk Steel (OJSC NLMK) signed a 4-year, EUR 600 million syndicated revolving credit facility with a group of Chinese and non-Chinese banks for general corporate purposes. The loan includes an accordion option that allows the borrower to increase the size of the loan to EUR 1 billion. ING Bank N.V. acted as Co-ordinating Mandated Lead Arranger. Crédit Agricole Corporate and Investment Bank, Natixis, Société Générale, AO Raiffeisenbank, Bank of America Merrill Lynch International Designated Activity Company, Mizuho Bank, Ltd., Deutsche Bank AG, London Branch, Bank ICBC (JSC), UniCredit S.p.A. and Intesa Sanpaolo Bank Ireland Plc acted as Mandated Lead Arrangers and UniCredit S.p.A. acted as Facility Agent.
justification: Syndicated loan for general corporate purposes without specific environmental or energy transition focus
evidence: General corporate purposes, financial services nature of the transaction

title: China Construction Bank contributes to $4.15 billion syndicated loan to help Norilsk Nickel refinance its repayment obligations (Linked to Project ID#95873 and 95876)
description: On February 20, 2020, PJSC MMC Norilsk Nickel signed a $4.15 billion syndicated facility agreement with a group of Chinese and non-Chinese banks. The loan carried a 7-year maturity and an interest rate of LIBOR plus 150 basis points. The borrower was expected to use the proceeds of the loan to service the company’s outstanding debts, finance capital expenditure, and for general corporate purposes. Members of the syndicated loan included Agricultural Bank of China (Moscow) Limited, Bank of China Limited Macau branch, Bank of China Limited Hungarian Branch, China Construction Bank Corporation, Seoul Branch, China Construction Bank (Russia) limited, AO Citibank, Commerzbank Aktiengesellschaft, filiale Luxemburg, Crédit Agricole Corporate and Investment Bank, Crédit Agricole Corporate and Investment Bank, London Branch, Credit Suisse AG, Deutsche Bank AG, London Branch, ING Bank, a Branch of ING-DiBa AG, Banca IMI S.P.A, London Branch, Všeobecná úverová banka, a.s., CIB Bank ltd, J.P.Morgan Securities plc, Mizuho bank, ltd., AO Mizuho Bank (Moscow), MUFG Bank, Ltd., Natixis, AO Raiffeisenbank, Société Générale, Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corporation Europe Limited, AO UniCredit Bank and UniCredit S.p.A. As of June 30, 2021, the loan’s outstanding amount was $4.065 billion.
staff_comments: 1. As of March 2021, the key shareholders of PJSC MMC Norilsk Nickel were Vladimir Potanin's Olderfrey Holdings Ltd (34.59%) and Oleg Deripaska's Rusal (27.82%).2. AidData has estimated the all-in interest rate (3.179%) by adding 150 basis points (1.5%) to average 6-month LIBOR in February 2020 (1.679%).3. The precise monetary values of the contributions of Agricultural Bank of China (Moscow) Limited, Bank of China Limited Macau Branch, Bank of China Limited Hungarian Branch, China Construction Bank Corporation, Seoul Branch, and China Construction Bank (Russia) Limited to the $4.15 billion syndicated loan are unknown. For the time being, AidData assumes equal contributions ($159,615,384) across the 26 known members of the loan syndicate. Therefore, the estimated financial contribution from Bank of China is USD 319,230,278 (see project ID#95873), the estimated contribution from China Construction Bank is USD 319,230,278 (see project ID#95872), and the estimated contribution from Agricultural Bank of China is USD 159,615,384 (see project ID#95876).4. The February 2020 loan agreement was an ‘amendment and restatement agreement’. It upsized a $2.5 billion syndicated loan facility that PJSC MMC Norilsk Nickel had signed on December 15, 2017 with a group of 16 lenders. It also added new lenders to the syndicate.4. The February 2020 loan agreement was an ‘amendment and restatement agreement’. It upsized a $2.5 billion syndicated loan facility that PJSC MMC Norilsk Nickel had signed on December 15, 2017 with a group of 16 lenders. It also added new lenders to the syndicate.

# Sector
BUSINESS AND OTHER SERVICES

# Title
China Construction Bank contributes to $4.15 billion syndicated loan to help Norilsk Nickel refinance its repayment obligations (Linked to Project ID#95873 and 95876)

# Description
On February 20, 2020, PJSC MMC Norilsk Nickel signed a $4.15 billion syndicated facility agreement with a group of Chinese and non-Chinese banks. The loan carried a 7-year maturity and an interest rate of LIBOR plus 150 basis points. The borrower was expected to use the proceeds of the loan to service the company’s outstanding debts, finance capital expenditure, and for general corporate purposes. Members of the syndicated loan included Agricultural Bank of China (Moscow) Limited, Bank of China Limited Macau branch, Bank of China Limited Hungarian Branch, China Construction Bank Corporation, Seoul Branch, China Construction Bank (Russia) limited, AO Citibank, Commerzbank Aktiengesellschaft, filiale Luxemburg, Crédit Agricole Corporate and Investment Bank, Crédit Agricole Corporate and Investment Bank, London Branch, Credit Suisse AG, Deutsche Bank AG, London Branch, ING Bank, a Branch of ING-DiBa AG, Banca IMI S.P.A, London Branch, Všeobecná úverová banka, a.s., CIB Bank ltd, J.P.Morgan Securities plc, Mizuho bank, ltd., AO Mizuho Bank (Moscow), MUFG Bank, Ltd., Natixis, AO Raiffeisenbank, Société Générale, Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corporation Europe Limited, AO UniCredit Bank and UniCredit S.p.A. As of June 30, 2021, the loan’s outstanding amount was $4.065 billion.
justification: The project involves a syndicated loan for general corporate purposes and debt refinancing, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Loan proceeds to be used for servicing outstanding debts, financing capital expenditure, and general corporate purposes

title: China Eximbank provides RMB 1.499 billion government concessional loan for the construction of the 43.5 MW Nyabarongo II Hydropower Plant and 110kV Evacuation Transmission Line Project
description: On February 7, 2020, the Government of Rwanda and the People’s Republic of China signed a preferential loan framework agreement for the 43.5 MW Nyabarongo II Hydropower Plant and 110kV Evacuation Transmission Line Project. Then, on June 22, 2020, China Eximbank and the Government of Rwanda signed an RMB 1,499,000,000 ($214,027,700.11) government concessional loan (GCL) agreement [CHINA EXIMBANK GCL NO. (2019) 17 TOTAL NO. (688)] for the 43.5 MW Nyabarongo II Hydropower Plant and 110kV Evacuation Transmission Line Project. The GCL carries the following borrowing terms: a 20 year maturity, a 6.5 year (78 month) grace period, a 2% interest rate, a 0% default (penalty) interest rate, a 0.25% commitment fee, and a 0.25% (RMB 3,747,500) management fee. The borrower is expected to use the proceeds of the GCL to finance a $214,027,700.11 commercial contract [ID# 1l.07.023/7386/18/MD-EDCLIFG/rjg/ng] between the Energy Development Corporation Ltd (EDCL) and Sinohydro Corporation Limited, which was signed on June 6, 2018 and amended on April 2, 2019.   The project is expected to provide water supply, irrigation, and electrical power generation. It is also expected to mitigate the perpetual flooding downstream of the Nyabarongo River that has proved to be hazardous in recent years.  The project consists of 48 meter high concrete gravity dam — located near the town of Shyorongi, in Rulindo District, in the Northern Province of Rwanda (exact locational coordinates: -1.876667, 29.940278) — with crest of 228 meters and a surface power station with 2*8.5MW Keplan turbines just situated at the dam toe. The Nyabarongo II Multipurpose Dam, is a multipurpose dam under construction across the Nyabarongo River in Rwanda. The dam will measure 48 meters (157 ft) high and 228 meters (748 ft) long, creating a reservoir with storage capacity of 846,000,000 cubic meters (2.9876208046×1010 cubic ft).   The reservoir is also expected to provide irrigation water to an estimated 20,000 hectares (49,000 acres) of land, downstream of the dam site. In addition, the dam will host Nyabarongo II Hydroelectric Power Station, with installed generating capacity of 43.5 megawatts. In addition to the dam and power station, the project involves: (a) a bridge across the Nyabarongo River (b) a switchyard and a 110kV substation (c) a 110kV transmission line measuring 19 kilometers (12 mi), from the power station to the substation at Rulindo, where the energy will enter the national grid and (d) a permanent road to the site of the dam. The project is expected to create jobs to Rwandans during and after construction of the power plant. During peak period of construction, the project is expected to employ more than 700 Rwandans.    Sinohydro Corporation Limited is the EPC contract responsible for implementation. Construction began in April 2021 and the project is expected to reach completion within 56 months (December 1, 2025).
staff_comments: 1. The China Eximbank loan agreement can be accessed in its entirety via https://www.documentcloud.org/documents/20509406-rwa_2020_528. 2. The Chinese project title is 那巴龙格河二号水电站项目 or Nyabarongo II多功能水坝项目 or  那巴龙格电站项目.
combined_text:
# Sector
ENERGY

# Title
China Eximbank provides RMB 1.499 billion government concessional loan for the construction of the 43.5 MW Nyabarongo II Hydropower Plant and 110kV Evacuation Transmission Line Project

# Description
On February 7, 2020, the Government of Rwanda and the People’s Republic of China signed a preferential loan framework agreement for the 43.5 MW Nyabarongo II Hydropower Plant and 110kV Evacuation Transmission Line Project. Then, on June 22, 2020, China Eximbank and the Government of Rwanda signed an RMB 1,499,000,000 ($214,027,700.11) government concessional loan (GCL) agreement [CHINA EXIMBANK GCL NO. (2019) 17 TOTAL NO. (688)] for the 43.5 MW Nyabarongo II Hydropower Plant and 110kV Evacuation Transmission Line Project. The GCL carries the following borrowing terms: a 20 year maturity, a 6.5 year (78 month) grace period, a 2% interest rate, a 0% default (penalty) interest rate, a 0.25% commitment fee, and a 0.25% (RMB 3,747,500) management fee. The borrower is expected to use the proceeds of the GCL to finance a $214,027,700.11 commercial contract [ID# 1l.07.023/7386/18/MD-EDCLIFG/rjg/ng] between the Energy Development Corporation Ltd (EDCL) and Sinohydro Corporation Limited, which was signed on June 6, 2018 and amended on April 2, 2019.   The project is expected to provide water supply, irrigation, and electrical power generation. It is also expected to mitigate the perpetual flooding downstream of the Nyabarongo River that has proved to be hazardous in recent years.  The project consists of 48 meter high concrete gravity dam — located near the town of Shyorongi, in Rulindo District, in the Northern Province of Rwanda (exact locational coordinates: -1.876667, 29.940278) — with crest of 228 meters and a surface power station with 2*8.5MW Keplan turbines just situated at the dam toe. The Nyabarongo II Multipurpose Dam, is a multipurpose dam under construction across the Nyabarongo River in Rwanda. The dam will measure 48 meters (157 ft) high and 228 meters (748 ft) long, creating a reservoir with storage capacity of 846,000,000 cubic meters (2.9876208046×1010 cubic ft).   The reservoir is also expected to provide irrigation water to an estimated 20,000 hectares (49,000 acres) of land, downstream of the dam site. In addition, the dam will host Nyabarongo II Hydroelectric Power Station, with installed generating capacity of 43.5 megawatts. In addition to the dam and power station, the project involves: (a) a bridge across the Nyabarongo River (b) a switchyard and a 110kV substation (c) a 110kV transmission line measuring 19 kilometers (12 mi), from the power station to the substation at Rulindo, where the energy will enter the national grid and (d) a permanent road to the site of the dam. The project is expected to create jobs to Rwandans during and after construction of the power plant. During peak period of construction, the project is expected to employ more than 700 Rwandans.    Sinohydro Corporation Limited is the EPC contract responsible for implementation. Construction began in April 2021 and the project is expected to reach completion within 56 months (December 1, 2025).
justification: Primary purpose is renewable energy generation through hydropower, with additional benefits of flood control and irrigation
evidence: 43.5 MW Nyabarongo II Hydropower Plant, renewable energy focus, multipurpose dam with hydroelectric power station

title: Chinese Embassy donates food supplies worth RWF 24 million to Rwanda Wushu Association in May 2020
description: On May 20, 2020, the Chinese Embassy in Rwanda donated a batch of food supplies to the Rwanda Wushu Association worth RWF 24 million. The donated supplies included maize flour, beans, cooking oil and rice. The supplies weighed 28.8 tons. The donation will be distributed to 400 families of Kungfu players across Rwanda. It is intended to assist those impacted by Covid-19.   A donation ceremony took place and was attended by Didier Shema-Maboko, the Permanent Secretary of the Rwandan Ministry of Sports, and Richard Makuza, the Vice President of Rwanda Kungfu/Wushu Federation.
combined_text:
# Sector
EMERGENCY RESPONSE

# Title
Chinese Embassy donates food supplies worth RWF 24 million to Rwanda Wushu Association in May 2020

# Description

The donated supplies included maize flour, beans, cooking oil and rice. The supplies weighed 28.8 tons. The donation will be distributed to 400 families of Kungfu players across Rwanda. It is intended to assist those impacted by Covid-19.   A donation ceremony took place and was attended by Didier Shema-Maboko, the Permanent Secretary of the Rwandan Ministry of Sports, and Richard Makuza, the Vice President of Rwanda Kungfu/Wushu Federation.
justification: Project is a humanitarian donation with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Food supplies donation to assist families impacted by Covid-19, no energy or infrastructure components

title: Chinese Embassy donates furniture to FAWE Girls' School for girls' education in Rwanda in December 2020
description: On December 2, 2020, the Chinese Ambassador to Rwanda, Rao Hongwei, visited FAWE Girls' School in Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda, and donated 333 teaching desks and chairs on behalf of the Chinese Embassy. Before the donation, two students would share a desk. To prevent the spread of Covid-19, The donation handover ceremony was attended by Pauline Umwali, the Executive Administrator of the Gasabo district. Following the donation, Ambassador Rao visited the school library, multimedia room and other teaching places with Principal Kailaba.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
Chinese Embassy donates furniture to FAWE Girls' School for girls' education in Rwanda in December 2020

# Description
On December 2, 2020, the Chinese Ambassador to Rwanda, Rao Hongwei, visited FAWE Girls' School in Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda, and donated 333 teaching desks and chairs on behalf of the Chinese Embassy. Before the donation, two students would share a desk. To prevent the spread of Covid-19, The donation handover ceremony was attended by Pauline Umwali, the Executive Administrator of the Gasabo district. Following the donation, Ambassador Rao visited the school library, multimedia room and other teaching places with Principal Kailaba.
justification: Project focuses on educational support without direct environmental or energy transition implications
evidence: Donation of furniture to girls' school, focus on education and social development

title: Chinese government donates medical supplies to Rwanda Ministry of Health to fight against Covid-19 in April 2020 (linked to project ID#92429)
description: On April 26, 2020, a handover ceremony took place for the donation of medical supplies from the Chinese Government to Rwanda.The ceremony was held at the MPPC warehouse of Rwanda Biomedical Center (RBC) in Kigali. The Chinese Ambassador to Rwanda,  Rao Hongwei, the Minister of Health of Rwanda, Dr. Daniel Ngamije, and officials from RBC attended the ceremony.  During the ceremony, the supplies were handed over to the Ministry of Health of Rwanda. The supplies included 2,000 N95 face masks, 10,000 surgical masks, 2,000 items of disposable protective clothing, 500 infrared thermometers, 2,000 medical protective goggles, 10,000 pairs of shoes covers, and disposable sterilized rubber surgical gloves.  This is the first official batch of emergency supplies that the Chinese Government has donated to Rwanda. A second batch arrived in September of 2020 (see project ID#92429).
staff_comments: AidData has estimated the transaction amount for this donation based on price catalogues from the World Health Organization (WHO). Please see the TUFF Methodology for additional details.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Chinese government donates medical supplies to Rwanda Ministry of Health to fight against Covid-19 in April 2020 (linked to project ID#92429)

# Description
On April 26, 2020, a handover ceremony took place for the donation of medical supplies from the Chinese Government to Rwanda.The ceremony was held at the MPPC warehouse of Rwanda Biomedical Center (RBC) in Kigali. The Chinese Ambassador to Rwanda,  Rao Hongwei, the Minister of Health of Rwanda, Dr. Daniel Ngamije, and officials from RBC attended the ceremony.  During the ceremony, the supplies were handed over to the Ministry of Health of Rwanda. The supplies included 2,000 N95 face masks, 10,000 surgical masks, 2,000 items of disposable protective clothing, 500 infrared thermometers, 2,000 medical protective goggles, 10,000 pairs of shoes covers, and disposable sterilized rubber surgical gloves.  This is the first official batch of emergency supplies that the Chinese Government has donated to Rwanda. A second batch arrived in September of 2020 (see project ID#92429).
justification: Project involves donation of medical supplies for public health purposes with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Medical supplies donation including masks, protective equipment, and thermometers for COVID-19 response

title: People's Liberation Army donates medical supplies worth USD 290,000 to Rwanda Defense Force  to fight against Covid-19 in June 2020
description: On June 3, 2020, medical supplies from China worth USD 290,000 arrived at Kigali International Airport. The supplies were donated to the Rwanda Defense Force (RDF) from the People's Liberation Army of China. Rao Hongwei, China’s Ambassador to Rwanda, and General Jean Bosco Kazura, the Chief of Defense Staff of Rwanda Defense Force, signed the handover certificate at the airport upon the arrival of the supplies.  The donated medical supplies were valued at USD 290,000 and included 50,000 units of disposable medical masks, 6,000 surgical masks, 6,000 medical N95 respirators, 4,200 medical safety goggles, 3,000 disposable medical protective face shields, 3,000 disposable one-piece protective gowns, 3,000 waterproof isolation gowns, 6,000 medical boots covers, 50 disposable nitrile gloves, 30 infusion pumps,  50 non-contact forehead infrared thermometers, 2 knapsack disinfection sprayers (16L) and 2 helmets for infrared temperature measurement.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
People's Liberation Army donates medical supplies worth USD 290,000 to Rwanda Defense Force  to fight against Covid-19 in June 2020

# Description
On June 3, 2020, medical supplies from China worth USD 290,000 arrived at Kigali International Airport. The supplies were donated to the Rwanda Defense Force (RDF) from the People's Liberation Army of China. Rao Hongwei, China’s Ambassador to Rwanda, and General Jean Bosco Kazura, the Chief of Defense Staff of Rwanda Defense Force, signed the handover certificate at the airport upon the arrival of the supplies.  The donated medical supplies were valued at USD 290,000 and included 50,000 units of disposable medical masks, 6,000 surgical masks, 6,000 medical N95 respirators, 4,200 medical safety goggles, 3,000 disposable medical protective face shields, 3,000 disposable one-piece protective gowns, 3,000 waterproof isolation gowns, 6,000 medical boots covers, 50 disposable nitrile gloves, 30 infusion pumps,  50 non-contact forehead infrared thermometers, 2 knapsack disinfection sprayers (16L) and 2 helmets for infrared temperature measurement.
justification: Project involves donation of medical supplies for healthcare purposes, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Medical supplies including masks, protective equipment, and medical devices for COVID-19 response
